item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰工人将于五月就加入 UAW 事宜进行投票
item.description: 美国全国劳资关系委员会（NLRB）周四表示，阿拉巴马州万斯奔驰工厂的工人将于 5 月 13 日至 5 月 17 日投票决定是否加入联合汽车工人工会。【原文：Workers at a Mercedes Benz factory in Vance, Alabama will vote between May 13 and May 17 on whether to join the United Auto Workers union, the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 3 月成屋销售下降；中位数价格上涨
item.description: 由于利率和房价的上涨使购房者对市场望而却步，3 月份美国成屋销售下降。【原文：U.S. existing home sales fell in March as higher interest rates and house prices sidelined buyers from the market.】

item.title: 联合健康旗下 Change Healthcare 在处理部分医疗索赔时遇到问题
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）周四表示，其 Change Healthcare 部门提供的一项服务在接收客户的医疗索赔批次时遇到了问题。【原文：UnitedHealth Group said on Thursday a service provided by its Change Healthcare unit was facing an issue receiving batches of medical claims from customers.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数低位持平
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量维持在低水平，表明劳动力市场持续强劲。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits was unchanged at low levels last week, pointing to continued labor market strength.】

item.title: 电动工具需求疲软，Snap-On 季度销售额不及预期
item.description: 由于汽车服务和维修技术人员购买公司生产的工具和设备的数量减少，抵消了汽车经销商对公司产品的稳定需求，Snap-On 公司周四的第一季度销售额未能达到华尔街的预期。【原文：Snap-On missed Wall Street estimates for first-quarter sales on Thursday, as vehicle service and repair technicians bought fewer tools and equipment made by the company, offsetting steady demand for its products from auto dealerships.】

item.title: KeyCorp 和 Comerica 与其他主要贷款机构一样，利息收入受到冲击
item.description: KeyCorp 和 Comerica 周四表示，由于借贷成本上升抑制了贷款需求，预计 2024 年的利息收入将下降，这与本财报季美国大型贷款机构所表达的担忧如出一辙。【原文：KeyCorp and Comerica are expecting a fall in interest income in 2024 as higher borrowing costs temper loan demand, they said on Thursday, echoing fears flagged by bigger U.S. lenders this earnings season.】

item.title: Blackstone 报告第一季度盈利增长 1
item.description: 全球最大的私募股权投资公司黑石集团（Blackstone Inc）周四表示，其第一季度可分配利润同比增长 1%，主要得益于费用相关收益的增长，但部分增长被资产剥离收入的下降所抵消。【原文：Blackstone Inc , the world's largest private equity firm, said on Thursday that its first-quarter distributable earnings rose 1% year-on-year supported by growth in fee-related earnings that was partly offset by a decline in income from asset divestments.】

item.title: 谷歌解雇 28 名抗议以色列云合同的员工
item.description: 谷歌周四表示，在一些员工参与抗议该公司与以色列政府签订云合同后，该公司已解雇了 28 名员工。【原文：Google said on Thursday it had terminated 28 employees after some staff participated in protests against the company's cloud contract with the Israeli government.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称美元的主导储备货币地位将持续下去
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）在周四的一份报告中说，美元的主导储备货币地位可能会持续下去，部分原因是缺乏包括人民币在内的可信挑战者。【原文：The U.S. dollar's dominant reserve currency status is likely to endure partly because credible challengers, including the Chinese yuan, are lacking, Morgan Stanley said in a report on Thursday.】

item.title: 住房供应紧张，美国住宅建筑商 D.R. Horton 利润上升
item.description: 周四，D.R. Horton 公布季度利润增长，原因是美国紧张的住房供应促进了房屋销售。【原文：D.R. Horton posted a rise in quarterly profit on Thursday, as tight housing supply in the United States lifted home sales.】

item.title: 巴西在亚马逊钻探石油的计划遭到土著居民的强烈抵制
item.description: 国营能源公司巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）的首要勘探项目遭到土著团体和政府机构越来越多的抵制，该项目将把巴西北部海岸最有潜力的地区开放给石油钻探。【原文：State-run energy firm Petrobras has hit growing resistance from Indigenous groups and government agencies to its premier exploration project, which would open the most promising part of Brazil's northern coast to oil drilling.】

item.title: 独家报道面对美国压力，墨西哥将停止对中国电动汽车制造商的激励措施
item.description: 三位熟悉内情的墨西哥官员表示，在美国的压力下，墨西哥联邦政府拒绝为电动汽车生产投资提供低成本公共土地或减税等激励措施，从而与中国汽车制造商保持距离。【原文：Mexico's federal government, under pressure from the U.S., is keeping Chinese automakers at arm's length by refusing to offer such incentives as low-cost public land or tax cuts for investment in EV production, three Mexican officials familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 巴拉圭大豆产量有望创历史新高，但河流水位低导致出口放缓
item.description: 巴拉圭的大豆收成将创历史新高，但出口商担心，由于巴西中西部的干旱影响了下游的水位，巴拉圭-巴拉那重要水道的河水水位过低，导致运输放缓。【原文：Paraguay is headed for a record soybean harvest but exporters are worried about low river levels that are slowing shipments along the key Paraguay-Paraná waterway, with a drought in central-west Brazil affecting water levels running downstream.】

item.title: 聚焦：巴拿马大选不太可能改变第一量子铜矿的前景
item.description: 路透社对竞选提案的审查和对抗议领袖的采访显示，第一量子矿业公司（First Quantum Minerals）在 5 月总统大选后收回被取消的利润丰厚的铜矿特许权的前景并不乐观。【原文：Prospects are poor for First Quantum Minerals to recover its canceled concession for a lucrative copper mine after presidential elections in May, a Reuters review of the campaigns' proposals and interviews with protest leaders show.】

item.title: 早间竞价：科技财报在即，油价和美元回落带来平静
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 芯片股抛售后反弹，期货上涨
item.description: 美国 500 指数和纳斯达克指数期货周四上涨，原因是一些芯片股在遭遇抛售后收复了失地，同时投资者在等待美联储决策者在经济数据表现强劲的情况下对降息的立场。【原文：Futures for the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq gained on Thursday as some chip stocks recouped losses after a sell-off, while investors awaited Federal Reserve policymakers' stance on interest-rate cuts in the face of resilient economic data.】

item.title: 小米称其新型电动汽车的销量比预期高出 3-5 倍
item.description: 中国小米公司周四表示，其运动型电动汽车的销量比预期高出3-5倍，并已开始交付SU7（Speed Ultra 7的简称），比之前宣布的时间提前了12天。【原文：China's Xiaomi said on Thursday that sales of its sporty electric vehicle have been 3-5 times higher than expected, and it had started deliveries of the SU7 - short for Speed Ultra 7 - 12 days earlier than previously announced.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司预计第二季度利润高于预期，原因是旅游需求强劲
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空集团（Alaska Air Group）周四预测，受强劲的旅游需求和夏季旺季预期的推动，本季度利润将好于预期。【原文：Alaska Air Group forecast a better-than-expected profit for the current quarter on Thursday, driven by strong travel demand and expectations for a strong summer season.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司将波音产品的质量和安全置于生产率之上
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空集团（Alaska Air Group）一位高层管理人员周四表示，该公司并不关心波音公司 737 MAX 飞机的生产速度，因为该公司更关注波音公司飞机的质量和安全性。【原文：Alaska Air Group is not concerned about the production rate of Boeing's 737 MAX planes as it is more focused on the quality and safety of the planemaker's jets, a top company executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特斯拉称德国解雇 300 名分包工人
item.description: 特斯拉汽车公司周四表示，该公司已按照合同期限辞退了德国的 300 名临时工，公司正努力将全球员工人数减少 10%。【原文：Tesla has let go of 300 temporary workers in Germany in keeping with their contract period, the e-car maker said on Thursday, amid a drive by the company to slim down its global workforce by 10%.】

item.title: Binance 获得迪拜许可证，瞄准零售客户
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Binance 周四表示，它已获得迪拜监管机构 VARA 颁发的许可证，该许可证将允许该平台除面向合格客户和机构客户外，还面向零售客户。【原文：Cryptocurrency exchange Binance said on Thursday it had secured a licence from Dubai's regulator VARA that will allow the platform to target retail clients in addition to qualified and institutional ones.】

item.title: 德金多斯称欧洲央行对 6 月降息 "非常明确
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）周四表示，欧洲央行已 "明确 "表示可能在6月份降息，但同时也坚定地表示，6月份之后的政策决定仍然悬而未决。【原文：The European Central Bank has made it "crystal clear" that interest rates could be cut in June but has also been firm that policy decisions beyond that remain up in the air, ECB Vice President Luis de Guindos said on Thursday.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金支持NatWest收购更多国有股票的计划
item.description: 挪威1.6万亿美元的主权财富基金是世界上最大的投资者之一，该基金周四表示，将投票赞成让NatWest银行从英国政府手中回购更多股票的提议，以加快私有化进程。【原文：Norway's $1.6 trillion sovereign wealth fund, one of the world's largest investors, said on Thursday it would vote in favour of a proposal letting NatWest buy back more of its stock from the British government, amid efforts to speed up privatisation.】

item.title: 德国 2 月住宅建筑许可下滑 18%，延续颓势
item.description: 德国政府周四公布的数据显示，2月份德国公寓建筑许可同比下降了18.3%，凸显了建筑和房地产业需求的持续低迷。【原文：Building permits for apartments in Germany fell 18.3% in February from a year earlier, government data on Thursday showed, underscoring a continued downturn in demand in the construction and real estate industry.】

item.title: Concord Chorus 将以 14 亿美元收购音乐投资商 Hipgnosis Songs Fund
item.description: 音乐和戏剧版权公司 Concord Chorus 已同意以 14 亿美元的价格收购英国音乐投资商 Hipgnosis Songs Fund。【原文：Concord Chorus, a music and theatrical rights firm, has agreed to acquire British music investor Hipgnosis Songs Fund for $1.40 billion, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: ACEA 称复活节提前导致欧盟 3 月新车销量下降 5.2
item.description: 欧洲汽车行业机构周四表示，受复活节假期提前和市场低迷的影响，3月份欧盟新车销量同比下降了5.2%，这是今年以来的首次下降，也是自2022年7月以来的最大降幅。【原文：New car sales in the European Union fell by 5.2% year-on-year in March, marking the first decline this year and the biggest since July 2022, Europe's auto industry body said on Thursday, citing the impact of early Easter holidays and a market downturn.】

item.title: 英国易捷航空公司削减冬季亏损，称夏季需求增加
item.description: 英国易捷航空公司（EasyJet）表示，与去年相比，该公司的冬季亏损已减少了 5000 多万英镑（6234 万美元），而且对其航班和假期的需求正在为关键的夏季旺季而增加。【原文：British airline easyJet said it had reduced its winter losses by more than 50 million pounds ($62.34 million) compared with last year and demand for its flights and holidays was building for the key summer season.】

item.title: 苹果公司计划投资超过 2.5 亿美元扩建新加坡园区
item.description: 根据苹果公司 4 月 17 日的一份声明，该公司计划投资超过 2.5 亿美元，以扩大其在新加坡宏茂桥的地区园区或业务。【原文：Apple Inc plans to invest more than $250 million to expand its regional campus or operations in Ang Mo Kio, Singapore, according to a company statement dated April 17.】

item.title: 中国央行警告不要 "片面 "追求信贷扩张
item.description: 在数据显示银行贷款放缓之后，中国央行周四警告说，不要 "片面 "追求信贷扩张，并誓言将信贷质量置于信贷规模之上，同时采取行动盘活现有贷款。【原文：China's central bank cautioned on Thursday against a "one-sided" pursuit of credit expansion after data showed a slowdown in bank lending, vowing to prioritise the quality of credit over size and move to revitalise existing loans.】

item.title: 美股震荡可能推动波动率挂钩基金加大抛售力度
item.description: 与波动性挂钩的投资策略正在加入美股的抛售潮，如果市场波动继续加剧，这些策略可能会帮助美股加速下跌。【原文：Volatility-linked investment strategies are joining the nascent sell-off in U.S. stocks and could help accelerate declines if market gyrations keep increasing.】
